common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Users reported various bugs in the Pieces Desktop Application across macOS and Windows. These include incorrect calendar day associations in chat summaries, incomplete or incorrect code generation from LLMs, and inverted arrow key scrolling in Copilot conversations.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and implement fixes for these issues.

related_issues.title: Problems with calendar days
related_issues.text:
Problems with calendar days
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using chat, I've notices in several occasions that when I ask something like "Give me a summary of what I did between May 2 and today", it always messes up the calendar days like saying "Monday - May 2" and it was a Friday. And its difficult to get it to properly give the date with the correct day "Monday, Tuesday, etc". Kind of makes me doubt if its actually saving and giving me the proper info of the dates for activities and everything.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Arrow keys inverted when scrolling through Copilot conversation
related_issues.text:
Arrow keys inverted when scrolling through Copilot conversation
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Arrow keyboard input for up and down keys is inverted when using the keyboard to scroll through a Pieces Copilot conversation.

Steps to reproduce:

- Open Pieces Desktop (4.1.2 macOS in my case)
- Make sure to open Pieces Copilot view
- Open a conversation that's long enough to have overflow content in the chat window
- Click on the chat window or input box to make sure the focus is on the conversation (and not focused on the left-side conversation list)
- Use the up and down arrow keys to scroll through the conversation content.

Expected behaviour: Actually I'm a lifelong flight simulator gamer so I really don't mind the actual behaviour I'm getting, but I imagine the expected behaviour would be for down key to scroll down through the content and up key to scroll up.

Actual behaviour: Y-axis is inverted. I have to press up to scroll down through a conversation, and down key to scroll up.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Freezes and High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop freezing after inactivity, especially after using chat, on Windows and macOS.  High CPU and GPU usage is also observed, particularly on older macOS systems with Intel chipsets. Issues occur with various Pieces OS versions (11.3.6-11.4.1) and Desktop versions (4.1.2-4.1.3).  Restarting the application temporarily resolves the freezing issue. Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and provide a permanent solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
related_issues.text:
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Start Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers and use them as normal.
2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset.
related_issues.text: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset. ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.3.6 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. When i run pieces desktop app and pieces os. My macbook pro fan starts at the top speed which results to slows down my pc. I will add some details related to my macbook and pieces version with some screen shots. **Mac details -** Processor - 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 Graphics - Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB Memory - 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 MacOS - 15.5 (24F74) Pieces Desktop version - 4.1.2 Pieces OS - 11.3.6 **Images for CPU and GPU Usage** Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Windows Freezes/Crashes with LTM
common_issues.description: Multiple reports on Windows show Pieces freezing or crashing, often related to LTM usage or large content. Issues appear across Pieces CLI, Desktop app, and OS versions 11.3.6-11.4.1. CLI shows LTM context failure. Desktop freezes after inactivity, especially after chat interaction with LTM enabled.  Large content in browser tabs also triggers crashes.  Users report no relevant logs. Further investigation needed to isolate LTM's role and potential memory issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Windows Freezes and Crashes
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Windows freezing and crashing under various conditions.  One user experienced an indefinite loading state with the copy button in VS Code extension. Another user reported crashes when viewing large amounts of content in Chrome, such as long logs. A third user observed frequent freezes after periods of inactivity, especially after interacting with chat features.  Issues appear across recent Pieces versions (11.3.6.0, 11.4.0, 11.4.1).

Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate and fix the bugs in the Pieces Desktop Application related to calendar day associations, incomplete code generation from LLMs, and inverted arrow key scrolling.

Address the freezing and high resource usage issues reported on Windows and macOS, particularly after chat usage and on older macOS systems with Intel chipsets. Investigate LTM's potential role in these issues.
Resolve the LTM context failure in Pieces CLI on Windows and ensure consistent LTM functionality across all platforms.
Investigate and fix the crashes reported on Windows related to large content in Chrome tabs and after inactivity, especially following chat interactions.
Address the indefinite loading state of the copy button in the VS Code extension on Windows.
Prioritize the most active tickets, particularly #716 (LLM code generation), #718 (Windows crashes with large content), and #710 (High resource usage on older macOS).
